intro: Barleria molensis, commonly known as the blue barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its showy, tubular flowers are usually blue or violet, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Barleria molensis thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
